pinyin: Shi4 jie4 Ren2 quan2 Xuan1 yan2

definition: Manifesto of the Communist Party/"Manifest der Kommunistischen Partei" by Marx and Engels (1848)

sentences.english: Jefferson wrote, was the declaration of independence was "the referee" alliance.
sentences.chinese: 傑斐遜曾寫道，《獨立宣言》是“籲請世界的裁判”。

sentences.english: Once the Alliance was truly formed, Mothma wrote the "Declaration of Rebellion."
sentences.chinese: 同盟一旦真正成立，莫思瑪就寫了《起義宣言》。

sentences.english: The manifesto marks off the two epochs in the history of the Three People's Principles.
sentences.chinese: 這篇宣言，區分了三民主義的兩個歷史時代。

sentences.english: According to Jim, manifestos keep people away from thinking and asking questions.
sentences.chinese: 按Jim所說，宣言阻止了人們思考和提出問題。

sentences.english: We also urge opposition parties to present their manifestoes to voters as early as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我們還敦促在野黨儘早發佈他們對選民的政治宣言。

sentences.english: What these actors did was make a statement with body language.
sentences.chinese: 這一衆演員要作的是，以身體語言作一個宣言。

sentences.english: A basis for COC consultations is the implementation of the DOC.
sentences.chinese: “準則”磋商是建立在落實《宣言》基礎上的。

sentences.english: But the letter was not intended to be a manifesto.
sentences.chinese: 但是也不能把這封信說成是一項宣言。
四國在莫斯科宣言10月30號。

sentences.english: I am a raver, and this is my manifesto.
sentences.chinese: 我是一名黑客，以上是我的宣言。

sentences.english: Where the Declaration of Independence was signed?
The most perplexing word in the declaration is equality.
sentences.chinese: “平等”是獨立宣言中最爲棘手的字眼。

sentences.english: Men are most often the abject victims of such a statement.
sentences.chinese: 通常都是男性成爲這種宣言的悲慘受害者。

sentences.english: But Jefferson, the chief architect of the Declaration of Independence, believed otherwise.
sentences.chinese: 但《獨立宣言》的設計師傑斐遜不以爲然。

sentences.english: The leaders of ASEAN, China, Japan and Korea issued the Kuala Lumpur Declaration.
sentences.chinese: 東盟和中日韓領導人在會上發表了《吉隆坡宣言》。

sentences.english: The time forrestatingre-stating well known positions is past.
sentences.chinese: 重新宣言知名位置已經過去。

definition: to swear an oath (of office)/to make a vow
lit. if thrown on the floor, it will make a sound (idiom)/fig. (of one's words) powerful and resonating/to have substance
to declare one's position/to say where one stands
